quotes.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "A Muslim is the one who avoids harming Muslims with his tongue and hands. And a Muhajir (emigrant) is the one who gives up (abandons) all what Allah has forbidden."
quotes.author: (Sahih al-Bukhari 8)

quotes.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "None of you will have faith till he wishes for his (Muslim) brother what he likes for himself."
quotes.author: (Sahih al-Bukhari 13)

quotes.text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said "None of you will have faith till he loves me more than his father, his children and all mankind."
quotes.author: (Sahih al-Bukhari 15)

quotes.text: Abdullah asked the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) "Which deed is the dearest to Allah?" He replied, "To offer the prayers at their early stated fixed times."
quotes.author: (Sahih al-Bukhari 527)

quotes.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
